column4: cong: dammit. i was so excited that that might have fixed it.
just the same in both firefox and chromium.
yourdaddy: downgraded to make flash work? or are you talking about something else.
cong: i did reinstall flash player. i just went in to chromium's about:plugins, and sure enough, there are two of them again. one in flashplugin-installer and the other one regular.
maybe if i delete just the one.
can you give a pastebin of the output of: lsb_release -a; uname -a; dpkg -l | egrep 'flash|gnash|swf|spark'
what is the output of: lsb_release -sc
and the output of: uname -m
try:  sudo apt-get --purge remove flashpluin-installer
morbo3000 enable the partner repo and install the adobe-flashplugin
in software centre enable the partner repo
sweet, close all web browsers then rerun it, should be ok
the web browser, to then use flash
if you run:  gksudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list     you can uncomment the lines with 'partner' on that start with the word 'deb'
then save the new file, close gedit and run: sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get install adobe-flashplugin
chrome does flash internally, not chromium
uninstall all flash packages and install chrome from the google website, you will then have flash
you need to download it separate
https://www.google.com/intl/en/chrome/browser/?platform=linux&hl=en
not heard of a package called gtk+ control, is that the actual name?
thats fine
if it wants to remove them, those packages are not critical
try http://rathergood.com/blode2
